conclusion: To find the position of the particle at t = 8 s, calculate the displacement over the time interval from t = 0 s to t = 8 s using the velocity-time graph.
The displacement is the area under the velocity-time graph.
Break down the graph into sections and calculate the area for each section.
From t = 0 s to t = 1 s, velocity increases linearly from 0 m/s to 2 m/s forming a right triangle.
Area from t = 0 s to t = 1 s is 1 m.
From t = 1 s to t = 3 s, velocity is constant at 2 m/s forming a rectangle.
Area from t = 1 s to t = 3 s is 4 m.
From t = 3 s to t = 4 s, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s forming a right triangle.
Area from t = 3 s to t = 4 s is 1 m.
From t = 4 s to t = 5 s, velocity decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -1 m/s forming a right triangle.
Area from t = 4 s to t = 5 s is -0.5 m due to negative velocity.
From t = 5 s to t = 7 s, velocity is constant at -1 m/s forming a rectangle.
Area from t = 5 s to t = 7 s is -2 m due to negative velocity.
From t = 7 s to t = 8 s, velocity increases linearly from -1 m/s to 0 m/s forming a right triangle.
